snippet: Mr. Flynn’s view that the C.I.A. is a political arm of the Obama administration isn’t widely shared in Washington but seems to have been internalized by Donald J. Trump....
abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump's dismissal of intelligence assessments offered by Central Intelligence Agency regarding possibility that Russian cyberattacks were meant to influence election in his favor carries echoes of Lt Gen Michael T Flynn's view that agency has become overtly political; Flynn, who is Trump's pick for national security adviser, has had substantial influence on Trump.

byline.contributor: Maggie Haberman contributed reporting from New York, and Eric Schmitt from Doha, Qatar.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Flynn’s view that the C.I.A. is a political arm of the Obama administration isn’t widely shared in Washington but seems to have been internalized by Donald J. Trump.

headline.main: Michael Flynn Is Harsh Judge of C.I.A.’s Role
headline.print_headline: Trump Adviser Is Harsh Judge of C.I.A.’s Role
